intro: Microstegium bequaertii, commonly known as the Bequaert's wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. Microstegium bequaertii is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in forest understories.
